BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Danger zones often hard to recognize
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger above 2000 m is moderate, below that altitude danger is low. Main problem: snowdrifts. Danger zones occur in steep ridgeline terrain on N/E-facing slopes, behind discontinuities in the terrain and in wind-loaded gullies and bowls, releases small-to-medium sized. Slabs can be triggered by 1 person, e.g. a skier. In isolated cases small loose-snow avalanches are possible on steep grass-covered slopes. Solar radiation triggering mostly small loose-snow avalanches in steep rocky terrain naturally.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The S/W winds will transport the snow. Inside fresh drifts, soft layers can lurk. Older snowdrifts are generally well bonded with the old snowpack. Due to warmth and radiation the snow is moistening, losing its bonding, can release as a loose-snow avalanche. The old snowpack is compact and stable, thoroughly moist, wet down to the ground.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Trigger-prone snowdrift accumulations will be able to settle due to sunshine and mild temperatures. Danger of dry-snow avalanches will recede.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is moderate. Main problem: snowdrift accumulations. Danger zones occur in steep ridgeline terrain on N/E facing slopes, behind discontinuities in the terrain and in wind-loaded gullies and bowls, releases small-to-medium sized. Slabs can be triggered by 1 person, e.g. a skier. In isolated cases small glide-snow avalanches are possible on steep grass-covered slopes, releases can be large. Solar radiation triggering mostly small loose-snow avalanches in steep rocky terrain naturally.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The S/W winds will transport the snow. Inside fresh drifts, soft layers can lurk. Older snowdrifts are generally well bonded with the old snowpack. Due to warmth and radiation the snow is moistening, losing its bonding, can release as a loose-snow avalanche. The old snowpack is compact and stable, thoroughly moist, wet down to the ground.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Trigger-prone snowdrift accumulations will be able to settle due to sunshine and mild temperatures. Danger of dry-snow avalanches will recede.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is low. Drifts can be problematic. Small slab avalanches can be triggered by 1 person in isolated high altitude areas, Danger zones occur on steep ridgeline north-facing slopes and in wind-loaded gullies and bowls. The danger of falling outweighs that of snow masses. In isolated cases small glide-snow avalanches are possible on steep grass-covered slopes, releases can be large. Solar radiation triggering mostly small loose-snow avalanches in steep rocky terrain naturally.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The S/W winds will transport the snow. Inside fresh drifts, soft layers can lurk. Older snowdrifts are generally well bonded with the old snowpack. Due to warmth and radiation the snow is moistening, losing its bonding, can release as a loose-snow avalanche. The old snowpack is compact and stable, thoroughly moist, wet down to the ground.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Trigger-prone snowdrift accumulations will be able to settle due to sunshine and mild temperatures. Danger of dry-snow avalanches will recede.
